required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: microRNA Profiles Identification in Adeno Carcinoma Prostate Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: In our study, the investigators want to find correlation between circulating miRNAs associated with prostate cancer metastases to bones and to lymph nodes separately with results of 68Ga-PSMA ligand PET (positron emission computed) imaging.

primary_outcome.description: Location of metastasis by a report analyzing the pathological examination (PET-MR output).

secondary_outcome.measure: MicroRNA profile by using Nano-string technology validated by real time PCR
secondary_outcome.description: Validation of MicroRNA pattern by using real time PCR

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Proven Adeno-carcinoma
- Underwent prostatectomy and still present high PSA levels
- Refered to PSMA exam.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Below 18 years old
- HIV/HBV (hepatitis B virus)/HCV (hepatitis C virus) positive
- Additional malignancy during the past five years.
